clusters.title: Magnitude 6 earthquake in eastern Afghanistan leaves at least 800 dead | First Thing
clusters.neutral_headline: Earthquake in Afghanistan kills hundreds, injures thousands

items.title: Magnitude 6 earthquake in eastern Afghanistan leaves at least 800 dead | First Thing
items.standfirst: Rescue efforts hampered by steep terrain after shallow quake that was felt more than 100 miles away in Kabul. Plus, the liberal who loves hunting and wants to change your mindGood morning.A powerful earthquake that hit eastern Afghanistan has left more than 800 people dead and injured about 2,500, according to Taliban officials.Is the death toll expected to rise? Yes, it’s expected to rise significantly as local hospitals report being inundated with casualties and hundreds still remain unaccounted for. Medics at the provincial hospital in Asadabad in Kunar described the situation as an overwhelming crisis, with new patients arriving every few minutes.Why does Trump want to mandate ID for voters? The voting reform push by Trump stems from baseless claims that the 2020 election he lost was stolen from him. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescue efforts hampered by steep terrain after shallow quake that was felt more than 100 miles away in Kabul. Plus, the liberal who loves hunting and wants to change your mindGood morning.A powerful earthquake that hit eastern Afghanistan has left more than 800 people dead and injured about 2,500, according to Taliban officials.Is the death toll expected to rise? Yes, it’s expected to rise significantly as local hospitals report being inundated with casualties and hundreds still remain unaccounted for. Medics at the provincial hospital in Asadabad in Kunar described the situation as an overwhelming crisis, with new patients arriving every few minutes.Why does Trump want to mandate ID for voters? The voting reform push by Trump stems from baseless claims that the 2020 election he lost was stolen from him. Continue reading...

items.title: Magnitude 6 earthquake in eastern Afghanistan leaves at least 800 dead
items.standfirst: Rescue efforts hampered by steep terrain after shallow quake that was felt more than 100 miles away in KabulAfghanistan earthquake – latest updatesA powerful earthquake that hit eastern Afghanistan has left more than 800 people dead and injured about 2,500, according to Taliban officials.The magnitude 6 earthquake hit four provinces in eastern Afghanistan around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged, mountainous region of Kunar the worst affected, triggering landslides and flooding. Continue reading...
items.content: Rescue efforts hampered by steep terrain after shallow quake that was felt more than 100 miles away in KabulAfghanistan earthquake – latest updatesA powerful earthquake that hit eastern Afghanistan has left more than 800 people dead and injured about 2,500, according to Taliban officials.The magnitude 6 earthquake hit four provinces in eastern Afghanistan around midnight on Sunday, with the rugged, mountainous region of Kunar the worst affected, triggering landslides and flooding. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A magnitude 6 earthquake struck eastern Afghanistan, causing widespread destruction.
Over 800 people are confirmed dead, with the death toll expected to rise significantly.
Approximately 2,500 people have been injured in the affected areas.
The mountainous terrain is hampering rescue efforts in the region.
Local hospitals are overwhelmed with casualties, creating a crisis situation.

items.title: Rudy Giuliani hospitalized after car accident in New Hampshire
items.standfirst: New York City’s ex-mayor, 81, in ‘good spirits’ after being treated for fractured thoracic vertebrae, cuts and bruisesNew York City’s former mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized after getting injured in a car wreck in New Hampshire over the weekend.On Sunday, Giuliani’s head of security, Michael Ragusa, released a statement, saying that the 81-year old was involved in a motor vehicle accident on Saturday evening. According to Ragusa, prior to the incident, Giuliani was flagged down by a woman who was the victim of a domestic violence incident. Continue reading...
items.content: New York City’s ex-mayor, 81, in ‘good spirits’ after being treated for fractured thoracic vertebrae, cuts and bruisesNew York City’s former mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized after getting injured in a car wreck in New Hampshire over the weekend.On Sunday, Giuliani’s head of security, Michael Ragusa, released a statement, saying that the 81-year old was involved in a motor vehicle accident on Saturday evening. According to Ragusa, prior to the incident, Giuliani was flagged down by a woman who was the victim of a domestic violence incident. Continue reading...

items.title: Rudy Giuliani hospitalized with broken vertebra after car accident, spokesperson says

items.content: Former New York City Mayor Rudy Giuliani has been hospitalized with a broken vertebra after a car accident in New Hampshire, according to his spokesperson. (Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)

ai_summary: Rudy Giuliani was involved in a car accident in New Hampshire.
Giuliani suffered fractured thoracic vertebrae, multiple lacerations, and contusions.
He also sustained injuries to his left arm and lower leg.
The accident occurred when Giuliani's car was struck from behind.
Giuliani's head of security stated he was in "good spirits" after the incident.

items.title: Royal Mail returns to profit as takeover brings ‘year of change’
items.standfirst: Rise in profit comes a year after parent company IDS agreed to acquisition by Daniel Křetínský’s EP GroupBusiness live – latest updatesRoyal Mail has made a profit for the first time in three years, its owner said in its first results since its £3.6bn takeover by the Czech billionaire Daniel Křetínský.International Distribution Services (IDS), which owns Royal Mail, said the postal service made a pre-tax profit of £194m in its financial year ended in March, up from a loss of £143m last year, as parcel volumes increased. Continue reading...
items.content: Rise in profit comes a year after parent company IDS agreed to acquisition by Daniel Křetínský’s EP GroupBusiness live – latest updatesRoyal Mail has made a profit for the first time in three years, its owner said in its first results since its £3.6bn takeover by the Czech billionaire Daniel Křetínský.International Distribution Services (IDS), which owns Royal Mail, said the postal service made a pre-tax profit of £194m in its financial year ended in March, up from a loss of £143m last year, as parcel volumes increased. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Royal Mail reported a pre-tax profit of £194 million for the fiscal year ending in March.
This profit follows a loss of £143 million in the previous year.
The company's owner, International Distribution Services (IDS), announced the results.
The profit comes after a £3.6 billion takeover by Daniel Křetínský’s EP Group.
Parcel volumes increased, contributing to the financial turnaround.

clusters.title: Putin and Modi seen holding hands ahead of meeting with Xi
clusters.neutral_headline: Xi Jinping criticises ‘bullying behaviour’ and Putin blames west for Ukraine war at Shanghai summit

items.title: Putin and Modi seen holding hands ahead of meeting with Xi
items.standfirst: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi were seen walking hand in hand ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Tianjin, China. The leaders’ closeness could be seen as a rebuke to President Trump, who imposed an additional 25% tariff on India after it purchased Russian oil, bringing the total tariff on the country to 50%.
items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi were seen walking hand in hand ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Tianjin, China. The leaders’ closeness could be seen as a rebuke to President Trump, who imposed an additional 25% tariff on India after it purchased Russian oil, bringing the total tariff on the country to 50%.

items.title: Xi Jinping criticises ‘bullying behaviour’ and Putin blames west for Ukraine war at Shanghai summit
items.standfirst: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...
items.content: China’s leader urges attendees to oppose ‘cold war mentality’ while Russian president claims Ukraine war was ‘provoked by the west’Xi Jinping has criticised the “bullying behaviour” of other countries while Vladimir Putin has blamed the west for his war on Ukraine, on the second day of a major summit in China which seeks to challenge western-led multilateral blocs.The Shanghai Cooperation Summit (SCO) began in the city of Tianjin on Sunday, with Xi welcoming dozens of leaders from Eurasian member states and other partner and observer countries, including Putin, and Indian prime minister Narendra Modi. Continue reading...

items.title: Putin, Modi and Erdoğan among leaders in China for talks with Xi
items.standfirst: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...
items.content: Chinese president hosts bilateral meetings on sidelines of Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinXi Jinping and Vladimir Putin have met on the sidelines of a showpiece summit in China that seeks to challenge US-led, western-dominated blocs and is being attended by the leaders of more than two dozen nations.The Chinese and Russian leaders, who are closely allied under what they have termed a “limitless” partnership, discussed Putin’s recent meeting with Donald Trump, according to a Kremlin official, who gave no further details. Continue reading...

items.title: Vladimir Putin meets Xi Jinping arrives in China for security summit – Ukraine war live
items.standfirst: Russian president and his Chinese counterpart shake hands as more than 20 world leaders attend Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinFollowing a meeting with Ukraine’s top general, Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that his country’s forces are planning new strikes deep into Russia.In a post on X, the Ukrainian leader wrote:We analysed in detail the situation in the Zaporizhzhia direction and the enemy’s intentions. Also the situation in the border areas of the Sumy and Kharkiv regions.We will continue our active operations in exactly the way needed for Ukraine’s defence. The forces and resources are prepared. New deep strikes have also been planned. Continue reading...
items.content: Russian president and his Chinese counterpart shake hands as more than 20 world leaders attend Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in TianjinFollowing a meeting with Ukraine’s top general, Oleksandr Syrsky, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that his country’s forces are planning new strikes deep into Russia.In a post on X, the Ukrainian leader wrote:We analysed in detail the situation in the Zaporizhzhia direction and the enemy’s intentions. Also the situation in the border areas of the Sumy and Kharkiv regions.We will continue our active operations in exactly the way needed for Ukraine’s defence. The forces and resources are prepared. New deep strikes have also been planned. Continue reading...

items.content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are among the 20 world leaders attending a regional security summit in China.

ai_summary: Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi were seen walking together before the summit.

Leaders from Eurasian countries and partners attended the summit.

clusters.title: Houthis detain at least 11 UN workers in raids on two agencies in Sana’a
clusters.neutral_headline: UN workers detained in Yemen by Houthi rebels

items.title: Houthis detain at least 11 UN workers in raids on two agencies in Sana’a
items.standfirst: UN condemns ‘arbitrary detentions’ by Iran-backed group at World Food Programme and Unicef offices in YemenThe Iranian-backed Houthis raided offices of the UN’s food, health and children’s agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining at least 11 employees, as the rebels tightened security across Sana’a after the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several cabinet members.The UN envoy for Yemen, Hans Grundberg, said on Sunday evening: “I strongly condemn the new wave of arbitrary detentions of UN personnel today in Sana’a and Hodeidah … as well as the forced entry into UN premises and seizure of UN property. At least 11 UN personnel were detained.” Continue reading...
items.content: UN condemns ‘arbitrary detentions’ by Iran-backed group at World Food Programme and Unicef offices in YemenThe Iranian-backed Houthis raided offices of the UN’s food, health and children’s agencies in Yemen’s capital, detaining at least 11 employees, as the rebels tightened security across Sana’a after the Israeli killing of their prime minister and several cabinet members.The UN envoy for Yemen, Hans Grundberg, said on Sunday evening: “I strongly condemn the new wave of arbitrary detentions of UN personnel today in Sana’a and Hodeidah … as well as the forced entry into UN premises and seizure of UN property. At least 11 UN personnel were detained.” Continue reading...

items.content: The Iran-backed Houthis on Sunday raided offices of the United Nations' food and children's agencies in Yemen's capital, detaining at least one U.N. employee, officials said.(Image credit: Osamah Abdulrahman/AP)

ai_summary: Houthi rebels raided UN offices in Yemen's capital, Sana'a.

The raids targeted the World Food Programme and UNICEF offices.
The Houthis have tightened security across Sana'a.

clusters.title: Israeli airstrike kills Houthi prime minister in Yemen, rebels say

items.title: Israeli airstrike kills Houthi prime minister in Yemen, rebels say
items.standfirst: Ahmed al-Rahawi killed alongside several ministers gathered for prerecorded speech by rebel group’s leaderAn Israeli airstrike killed the prime minister of the Houthi rebel-controlled government in Yemen’s capital, Sana’a, the Houthis have said.Ahmed al-Rahawi was killed in a strike in Sana’a on Thursday along with a number of ministers, the rebels said in a statement on Saturday. Other ministers and officials were wounded, the statement added without providing further details. Continue reading...
items.content: Ahmed al-Rahawi killed alongside several ministers gathered for prerecorded speech by rebel group’s leaderAn Israeli airstrike killed the prime minister of the Houthi rebel-controlled government in Yemen’s capital, Sana’a, the Houthis have said.Ahmed al-Rahawi was killed in a strike in Sana’a on Thursday along with a number of ministers, the rebels said in a statement on Saturday. Other ministers and officials were wounded, the statement added without providing further details. Continue reading...

ai_summary: OpenAI plans to build a new data center in India.
The data center will have at least 1-gigawatt capacity.
This could be a major step forward in Asia for OpenAI.
The project is part of OpenAI's Stargate-branded infrastructure push.
The data center will be located in India.

The Department of Veterans Affairs was ending nearly all of its collective bargaining agreements. The agency gave labor unions just days to get out of federal buildings. "We went in…

items.title: How Trump is decimating federal employee unions one step at a time
items.standfirst: President Trump has ended collective bargaining rights for more than one million federal workers. Unions have sued to block the move, but agencies are terminating contracts as litigation continues.
items.content: President Trump has ended collective bargaining rights for more than one million federal workers. Unions have sued to block the move, but agencies are terminating contracts as litigation continues.(Image credit: Rachel Woolf for NPR)

ai_summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs ended nearly all collective bargaining agreements in August.
Unions were given days to leave federal buildings, according to reports.
President Trump ended collective bargaining rights for over one million federal workers.
Unions have filed lawsuits to block the move, but agencies are terminating contracts.
The actions are part of a larger effort to limit union power within the government.

clusters.title: Isak signs with Liverpool from Newcastle for record British fee: Report
clusters.neutral_headline: Liverpool Agrees to Record Fee for Isak Transfer

items.title: Isak signs with Liverpool from Newcastle for record British fee: Report
items.standfirst: The Premier League champions' signing of the Swedish international closes the summer's most drawn-out transfer saga.
items.content: The Premier League champions' signing of the Swedish international closes the summer's most drawn-out transfer saga.

items.title: Liverpool agree British record £125m fee for Isak
items.standfirst: Liverpool agree British transfer record fee of £125m to sign striker Alexander Isak from Newcastle United.
items.content: Liverpool agree British transfer record fee of £125m to sign striker Alexander Isak from Newcastle United.

ai_summary: Liverpool agreed to a British record fee of £125 million for Alexander Isak.
Isak is a striker from Newcastle United, according to reports.
The transfer closes the summer's most drawn-out transfer saga.
The deal was reported by multiple news outlets.
The transfer fee is a record for a British club.

clusters.title: Israel says it killed Hamas spokesperson as offensive ramps up in Gaza City
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel Says It Killed Hamas Spokesperson in Gaza

items.title: Israel says it killed Hamas spokesperson as offensive ramps up in Gaza City
items.standfirst: Abu Obeida, the longtime spokesperson for Hamas' Qassam Brigades, was killed by an Israeli airstrike in Gaza over the weekend, Israel's defense minister claims.
items.content: Abu Obeida, the longtime spokesperson for Hamas' Qassam Brigades, was killed by an Israeli airstrike in Gaza over the weekend, Israel's defense minister claims.

items.title: Hamas spokesman Abu Obeida killed in Gaza, Israel says
items.standfirst: The military spokesman was killed in strikes on Saturday, Israel says - Hamas has not confirmed the death.
items.content: The military spokesman was killed in strikes on Saturday, Israel says - Hamas has not confirmed the death.

ai_summary: Israel claims it killed Hamas spokesperson Abu Obeida in an airstrike.
The airstrike occurred in Gaza over the weekend, according to Israel.
Abu Obeida was the longtime spokesperson for Hamas' Qassam Brigades.
Hamas has not confirmed the death of Abu Obeida.
The BBC reported the death of the Hamas spokesman.
